page.title: 13THE REBELLION CELEBRATIONS
page.content: Charles 2nd was succeeded by his brother James 2nd, but some people wanted James Duke of Monmouth to be king. The Duke of Monmouth sailed from France to Lyme Regis and raised an army mainly of farmers. And they went on to Axminster then onto Chard and through Ilminster and all over the west country, fighting. The final battle was at Sedgemoor where the Duke was defeated on July 6th.1685. Local people especially descendants of families who fought, have been celebrating this last battle on English soil. On Sunday June 16th 1985 There was an Ilminster Pageant, The Pageant went by Broadway. Local people dressed up as characters from the rebellion.
